Summary:

WELCOME TO THE APOCALYPSE

In DeuceÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s world, people earn the right to a name only if they survive their first fifteen years. By that point, each unnamed Ã¢â‚¬ËœbratÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ has trained into one of three groupsÃ¢â‚¬â€œBreeders, Builders, or Hunters, identifiable by the number of scars they bear on their arms. Deuce has wanted to be a Huntress for as long as she can remember.

As a Huntress, her purpose is clearÃ¢â‚¬â€to brave the dangerous tunnels outside the enclave and bring back meat to feed the group while evading ferocious monsters known as Freaks. SheÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s worked toward this goal her whole life, and nothingÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s going to stop her, not even a beautiful, brooding Hunter named Fade. When the mysterious boy becomes her partner, DeuceÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s troubles are just beginning.

Down below, deviation from the rules is punished swiftly and harshly, and Fade doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t like following orders. At first Deuce thinks heÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s crazy, but as death stalks their sanctuary, and it becomes clear the elders donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t always know best, Deuce wonders if Fade might be telling the truth. Her partner confuses her; sheÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s never known a boy like him before, as prone to touching her gently as using his knives with feral grace.

As DeuceÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s perception shifts, so does the balance in the constant battle for survival. The mindless Freaks, once considered a threat only due to their sheer numbers, show signs of cunning and strategyÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ but the elders refuse to heed any warnings. Despite imminent disaster, the enclave puts their faith in strictures and sacrifice instead. No matter how she tries, Deuce cannot stem the dark tide that carries her far from the only world sheÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s ever known. - Goodreads Summary of Enclave (Razorland #1)

Note: Book 3 has not been published yet but will reload when it is out! Suitable for a young adult audience. Many people like to relate this to the Hunger Games, and after reading immediately differentiate the two of them. A great series from a great author, you'll have to read it to decide for yourself!
